channel.title: Error
channel.description: hey , once again im getting errors running my server . i use utorrent to portforward i set the ports to 43594 and when i try to run my server it says [code]error:unable to setup listener on port 43594 - port already in use [/code] then when i try a diffrent port like 43595 it says online but no one can log in please help

item.title: Error
item.dc:creator: @endless_hood endless hood
item.description:
@endless_hood wrote:

[quote=“tonypker13, post:19, topic:228769”][quote author=endless hood link=topic=300848.msg2415407#msg2415407 date=1220116847]

Here- Ill help both of you out. Open up: Server.java and search for

    public static int serverlistenerPort

If that doesnt work search for ListenPort until u see something similar.

Next, youll see the this.

    public static int serverlistenerPort = 43594

Change 43594 to 5555. Next startup your server and make sure the server status ad says 5555.
Hope it helps!
-Tony

do i change my firewall settings to that aswell ? and on utorrent to i change the 43594 port to 555?

[/quote]
You shouldve mentioned you use Utorrent.
Try just changing what i said and then changing the firewall to 5555.[/quote]

lol i did mention im using utorrent[br][br][size=1]Posted on: August 31, 2008, 04:15:11 am[/size][hr]also im not running two run.bats

Read full topic

item.title: Error
item.dc:creator: @Brenz Brenz
item.description:
@Brenz wrote:

endless hood:

oh right , but when i try to run my server it says its offline to every one else

Do u have multiple computers in your home connected to the internet ? If so u need to find the correct IPv4 address for your host computer to forward 43594 to.

To do this:

  1. Go To start and open cmd.exe (on your host computer)
  2. Type ipconfig & hit enter
  3. Look for the IPv4 address, when portforwarding you have to make sure you are forwarding to that IP

Brendan

Read full topic

    public static int serverlistenerPort

If that doesnt work search for ListenPort until u see something similar.

Next, youll see the this.

    public static int serverlistenerPort = 43594

Change 43594 to 5555. Next startup your server and make sure the server status ad says 5555.
Hope it helps!
-Tony
[/quote]

do i change my firewall settings to that aswell ? and on utorrent to i change the 43594 port to 555?[/quote]
You shouldve mentioned you use Utorrent.
Try just changing what i said and then changing the firewall to 5555.

Read full topic

Are you trying to open up two run.bat’s? If you are thats whats causing the problem. And you have to start utorrent after you start your server.

item.description:
@endless_hood wrote:

[quote=“Brenz, post:13, topic:228769”]If you want your server as 43594 you need to go onto Utorrent settings and change its port, therefore making 43594 free for your server to use.

Brendan[/quote]

item.title: Error
item.dc:creator: @Brenz Brenz
item.description:
@Brenz wrote:

If you want your server as 43594 you need to go onto Utorrent settings and change its port, therefore making 43594 free for your server to use.

Brendan

Read full topic

item.title: Error
item.dc:creator: @endless_hood endless hood
item.description:
@endless_hood wrote:

[quote=“Brenz, post:11, topic:228769”]Right your internet connection has thousands of ports, each port can only handle one program so you cant use 2 different programs on the same port.

In your case the Default port for Utorrent is the same as your server, this means that one of them will have to be changed 2 use a different port in able to work.

So you have 2 options:

  1. Leave the Utorrent port and change your server port as explained in a previous post and portforward that one instead.

OR

  1. Change your Utorrent port and then ensure 43594 is forwarded for your server.

Brendan[/quote]

so if i want to run my server of port 43594 what would i have to do ?

p.s

your gonna be reped alot when im 15

Read full topic

item.title: Error
item.dc:creator: @Brenz Brenz
item.description:
@Brenz wrote:

Right your internet connection has thousands of ports, each port can only handle one program so you cant use 2 different programs on the same port.

In your case the Default port for Utorrent is the same as your server, this means that one of them will have to be changed 2 use a different port in able to work.

So you have 2 options:

  1. Leave the Utorrent port and change your server port as explained in a previous post and portforward that one instead.

OR

  1. Change your Utorrent port and then ensure 43594 is forwarded for your server.

Brendan

Read full topic

item.title: Error
item.dc:creator: @endless_hood endless hood
item.description:
@endless_hood wrote:

[quote=“Brenz, post:9, topic:228769”]You cant have Utorrent and your server on the same port, so u have to either have your server on 43594 and Utorrent on another port OR your server on 5555 and Utorrent on 43594.

If u use 5555 for your server make sure u forward that port aswell to the correct IPv4 address if u have multiple computers in your home.

Brendan[/quote]

ermm could u explain some more , ? i didnt quite get it

Read full topic

item.title: Error
item.dc:creator: @Brenz Brenz
item.description:
@Brenz wrote:

You cant have Utorrent and your server on the same port, so u have to either have your server on 43594 and Utorrent on another port OR your server on 5555 and Utorrent on 43594.

If u use 5555 for your server make sure u forward that port aswell to the correct IPv4 address if u have multiple computers in your home.

Brendan

Read full topic
